java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class SquareLatticePanel
extends TwoDimensionalLatticePanel

Creates the display area for a square-grid cellular automaton.

Author:
David Bahr

Method Detail

drawDefaultShapeOnGraphics

public void drawDefaultShapeOnGraphics(int row,
                                       int col,
                                       java.awt.Graphics2D g)
Draw a default shape for the lattice. This should be a quickly drawn shape. The graphics method fillRect() is relatively quick and is a good choice. Note that this method is only called when the CellStateView returns null for the shape to draw -- hence this is only a backup and a default.
This method can be used intentionally for speed. (When drawing a Shape would take too long, have the CellStateView return null for getDisplayShape(), then this method will draw quickly.)

Specified by:
drawDefaultShapeOnGraphics in class TwoDimensionalLatticePanel
Parameters:
row - The row position on the lattice.
col - The column position on the lattice.
g - The graphics object onto which the default shape should be drawn.

Draws a grid mesh on the graphics.

getCellUnderCursor

public Cell getCellUnderCursor(int xPos,
                               int yPos)
Return the cell displayed at the current cursor position xPos and YPos. This method is useful, for example, when we want to change the appearance or content of cells (with a mouse listener). This method is currently used to draw on the lattice.

Specified by:
getCellUnderCursor in class LatticePanel
Parameters:
xPos - The horizontal coordinate of the mouse.
yPos - The vertical coordinate of the mouse.
Returns:
The cell displayed at the position xPos, yPos on the graphics.

getCellHeightInPixels

public int getCellHeightInPixels(int row,
                                 int col)
The height of the bounding rectangle for each cell's graphics (when displayed on the panel) in integer pixels. The number of pixels per cell should never be less that 1, or it will not display.

Specified by:
getCellHeightInPixels in class TwoDimensionalLatticePanel
Parameters:
row - The row position on the lattice.
col - The column position on the lattice.
Returns:
The height.

rescaleWidthAndHeight

public PanelSize rescaleWidthAndHeight()
Rescale the width and height of the graphics panel so that it is the maximum permitted. This size may vary with the type of lattice. For example, the hexagonal lattice has rows that are offset (every other row is offset slightly to the right, unlike a square lattice); this increases the width of the lattice. So the panel's width and height have to be rescaled to reflect this.

Specified by:
rescaleWidthAndHeight in class TwoDimensionalLatticePanel
Returns:
A pair of integers for the width and height.
